DataElement.preferredName: Patient Progressive Disease Post Lenalidomide Administered Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to the patient having progression after lenalidomide.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Progressive Disease Post Lenalidomide Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._A thalidomide analog with potential antineoplastic activity.  Lenalidomide inhibits TNF-alpha production, stimulates T cells, reduces serum levels of the cytokines vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) and basic fibroblast growth factor (bFGF), and inhibits angiogenesis.  This agent also promotes G1 cell cycle arrest and apoptosis of malignant cells._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.:Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:A thalidomide analog with potential antineoplastic activity.  Lenalidomide inhibits TNF-alpha production, stimulates T cells, reduces serum levels of the cytokines vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) and basic fibroblast growth factor (bFGF), and inhibits angiogenesis.  This agent also promotes G1 cell cycle arrest and apoptosis of malignant cells.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

A thalidomide analog with potential antineoplastic activity.  Lenalidomide inhibits TNF-alpha production, stimulates T cells, reduces serum levels of the cytokines vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) and basic fibroblast growth factor (bFGF), and inhibits angiogenesis.  This agent also promotes G1 cell cycle arrest and apoptosis of malignant cells.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/8/2020: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016
